intro: Prenanthes amabilis, commonly known as the sweet peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Prenanthes amabilis is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in native plant gardens.
